site.name: Triton Framework
site.description: Official documentation for the Triton Framework — module loading, window chrome, class protection, and the Triton desktop runtime.

docs.title: AbstractModule
docs.description: Base class for every Triton module. Provides a thread-safe close lifecycle via AtomicBoolean, registered name tracking, and an on-close callback hook. Subclasses implement start(), onClose(), bringToFront(), hideModule(), showModule(), and isVisible(). The shell interacts with all modules exclusively through this contract.

docs.title: EchelonFrame
docs.description: Base JFrame for all Triton windows. Always undecorated with WindowFactory chrome, enrolled with EchelonWindowPlacer for smart screen placement, floats above the desktop while the app is active, and supports window-open animations via a thread-safe queue so rapid back-to-back module launches each get their own animation.

docs.title: WindowFactory
docs.description: Factory and utility class for custom Swing window chrome. Builds the macOS-style traffic-light title bar with a purple Move-to-Screen button, installs an 8-pixel edge/corner resizer, manages the animation queue, and provides dialog chrome helpers.

docs.title: CustomTitleBars
docs.description: FlatLaf-based custom title bar installer for JFrames and JDialogs. Installs globally via an AWT event listener and provides FrameTitleBar and DialogTitleBar components with drag, double-click maximize, active/inactive color transitions, and the purple Move-to-Screen button.

docs.title: EchelonChromeBridge
docs.description: Auto-applies Triton chrome to any JFrame opened at runtime, covering legacy modules that don't call WindowFactory directly. Uses a global AWT event listener and never double-decorates. Falls back gracefully if WindowFactory or FlatLaf are unavailable.

docs.title: ChromeContentPane
docs.description: Shielded JPanel content pane that preserves the chrome title bar in NORTH and transparently forwards all user add/remove/setLayout calls to an inner client panel. Hardened against early superclass calls during JFrame construction.

docs.title: CentralModuleOpener
docs.description: Central dispatch for opening any loadable item in the Triton desktop. Compiles and loads Java module directories via JDK or ECJ fallback, handles external JARs, named proxy modules, and native executables. Integrates with VortexManager so modules chain through VortexLoader and see all absorbed overrides and included classes.

docs.title: ModProtection
docs.description: Runtime annotation controlling whether a framework class can be overridden by module mod/ files. Supports ALLOW_MOD (silent override), DISALLOW_MOD (blocked with notification), and an implicit default that permits override but notifies the user.

docs.title: BottomBarMenuProvider
docs.description: Optional interface for modules that want a custom right-click context menu on their bottom bar button. Implement buildBottomBarMenu() to return a JPopupMenu with module-specific items. The shell appends default items (Bring to Front, Hide, Pin, Close) automatically after a separator.

docs.title: VortexLoader
docs.description: Custom ClassLoader that intercepts every class load and checks Vortex directories first. Supports system/ overrides that silently replace existing JAR classes and root includes that add brand-new classes. Supports both loose .class files and .jar bundles. Respects @Vortexable(LOCKED) annotations to protect sealed classes.

docs.title: VortexManager
docs.description: Singleton coordinator for the Vortex class-loading system. Manages VortexLoader lifecycle, the vortex-module/ directory structure, manifest persistence, staging, snapshots, and the programmatic deploy API. Initialize once at app startup before any class you want to override is referenced.

docs.title: VortexPlugin
docs.description: Plugin API core — VortexPlugin lifecycle interface, VortexAdapter convenience base class, @PluginMeta annotation, and PluginContext dependency injection interface. Covers the onLoad/onEnable/onDisable/onUnload lifecycle, configuration and data persistence, logging, plugin cross-referencing, and the typed service registry.

docs.title: VortexPluginTypes
docs.description: Plugin sub-interfaces that extend VortexPlugin — VortexService for background tasks with start/stop/isRunning, VortexCommand for executable commands that integrate with Troy voice control and the command palette, and VortexComponent for Swing UI widgets embeddable in the desktop. Any combination can be implemented on a single plugin class.

docs.title: Vortexable
docs.description: Runtime annotation controlling whether VortexLoader can override a class. Default policy is ABSORBABLE (opt-out model). LOCKED seals a class against absorption — checked reflectively on first load. INCLUDE marks a class as purely additive (enforced at directory level by VortexLoader). Distinct from @ModProtection which operates at the module level.
